result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Michael Barry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland today!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: Def to obtain domestic abuse/perpetrators counseling as directed and complete recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
No possession of drug paraphernalia
NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH C.F.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Cognitive Intervention Programming
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
All financial obligations are added to defendant's payment plan

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department.
Granted Good Time.
Granted Work Release.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and 15CM253 but CONSECUTIVE to 16CM198
Financial obligations as previously ordered to be paid through the Clerk of Courts office.

AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations, maintain abol. sob. no use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances, or any other mind altering substances. unless pres and prescribed. random testing, no presence at any place where mind altering substances are consumed. attend Domestic viol. perp. counseling $10 fine plus ct costs and surcharges. provide DNA, cognitive intervention programming. 15 CM253 ct 2 $10 plus ct cost sur charges. 16cm23 ct 3 20 days jail 3 day credit. ct cost. 15CM253- ct 2 amended crime to ordi. no contest adj. guilty. $10 forf plus cost $217.10 16CM23 ct 2 pleas no contact to four cts. 16CM23 4,5, readin dismiss understands  plea questionaire, no force, no mind altering substances, understands, wants ct enter pleas no contest.  Ct finds Def understands plea know and vol waives rights accepts pleas. DA wants no contact with Ms. Fisher or while intoxicated. Ct will follow agreement also Def must come in for early and periodic., probation reviews. 15CM253 $593.88.. 16CM23 ct 1 16cm23 ct 1 $ 488.88 ct 2 $488.88 civil filling fee $278.78 pay coc .. financial disclosure statement next week. no abusive contact or no contact if she wants it with Chanda Fisher. no possession drug para. 16CM23 ct 3 sent 20 days jail credit 3 days- gets good time work release   . in 1 week contact jail. no later then 4/10/16 @ 9am $465.15 ct cost
